description.narrative: The Embassy of Kingdom of the Netherlands (EKN) in Kigali has set a clear target to transform the bilateral relationship moving from aid towards trade. This decision resonates the national development strategy of the Rwandan government aiming to halt inflows of development aid. Building on established ties, there is scope to further strengthen Rwandan-Dutch relations through a program that fuels economic cooperation between the two countries. The key objective of this program is to support Dutch companies in Rwanda and contribute to sustainable private sector development through the management of a transition fund.

title.narrative: Annual plan TRAIDE published on October 31, 2019

description.narrative: Changes achieved in laws, regulations, policy plans, outcomes of social dialogue or development strategies due to program interventions

title.narrative: Laws, regulations, policy plans, social dialogue and development strategies

description.narrative: The third indicator looks at changes achieved in laws, regulations, policy plans, outcomes of social dialogue or development strategies due to program interventions. It is important to note that the mandate of TRAIDE related to this indicator is rather limited. Activities are only done when there is a direct interest or request by a company. A lack of policy interventions may therefore indicate a lack of requests by companies to take. However, TRAIDE pursued several policy changes and supported public-private dialogues (please refer to the narrative report).
Enhancement investments by private actors and donor in Rwanda

title.narrative: Amount of private (co)-investment and donor investments

description.narrative: Amount of private (co)-investment and donor investments

comment.narrative: The estimated baseline for invested capital is >461.2 million euros. Investments were only reported by twelve out of twenty-two companies. It is considered confidential information and hence, the actual number will likely be higher. It includes the support provided by financial institutions (like FMO) and donors (like the Netherlands Embassy).
One new Dutch investor has come to Rwanda.

description.narrative: Enhancement investments by private actors and donors in Rwanda

title.narrative: Amount of private (co)-investment and donor investments

description.narrative: The amount reported is an estimation based on new investments that were made in 2021 (e.g., investment in a solar project following TRAIDE’s activities in the energy sector). In addition, 5 new projects have commenced in 2021 as part of RVO’s PSD Toolkit, which increased the amount of donor investments. The amount reported is an estimation and is likely to be higher as existing companies make new investments throughout the year, which are not always included. Also, some companies and donors did not always want to report their actual investment.
Improved access of Dutch businesses to information regarding Rwandan business climate and investment opportunities

Business opportunity reports will be written to improve the availability and accuracy of market information for Dutch businesses. Also, additional documents may be published to provide Dutch investors with additional information.

comment.narrative: No TRAIDE publications existed prior to the start of the program.
Ten reports were published by the TRAIDE team.

description.narrative: Improved availability and accuracy of market information for Dutch businesses

title.narrative: Number of publications for improved availability and accuracy of market information for Dutch businesses

description.narrative: Business opportunity reports are written to improve the availability and accuracy of market information for Dutch businesses. In addition, TRAIDE publishes reports on doing business in Rwanda to provide Dutch investors with additional information on the local business climate and procedures. In 2021, TRAIDE and the Netherlands Embassy started to publish monthly investment bulletins (7 in 2021).
Imroved labour conditions for Rwandan employees thanks to Dutch companies
Number of employees with improved labor conditions working at Dutch companies in Rwanda

dimension.name: Number of employees with improved labor conditions

comment.narrative: The number of direct employees employed by businesses that apply the mentioned labor conditions is 456. The fact that certain employees did not mention specific labor conditions does not mean they do not apply them. Hence, the total number of direct employees with improved labor conditions is very likely to be higher than the one indicated.
No specific CSI support was provided to companies to enhance this number.

comment.narrative: The total number of jobs supported reported by 15 interviewees is 1203. However, the answer was only provided by 15 out of 22 companies and hence, it will likely be higher.

description.narrative: Increased employment opportunities in Rwanda thanks to Dutch companies

The estimation for 2021 made is based on the reported number in 2020, plus the number of employees of companies that were not part of the baseline and 2020 assessment but do have a local entity in Rwanda as of 2021.
Number of employees with improved labour conditions

title.narrative: Number of employees with improved labour conditions in accordance with international agreements

description.narrative: The number of employees with improved labour conditions is an outcome of the TRAIDE program beyond its direct sphere of influence and is therefore difficult to determine. The total number of direct employees with improved labour conditions is very likely to be higher than the one indicated. However, 1 company explicity mentioned that after reading the report ‘’Responsible Business Conduct: Wages in Rwanda’’ by TRAIDE, they increased the salaries of their local employees with 20%. Therefore, the reported number has increased too.

description.narrative: Strengthened business linkages between Dutch and Rwandan businesses

Business links are established through TRAIDE activities such as the organisation of trade missions or B2B facilitation. In 2021, 13 business linkages were made between Dutch companies and local companies or government agencies. In addition, the TRAIDE team organized 1 trade mission and 2 webinars (total number of participants: 96). The number of business linkages that come out of such events is indirect and is therefore not included in the reported numbers.

dimension.name: Number of business links between Dutch and Rwandan companies

description.narrative: Strengthened economic institutions in order to improve the investment climate
In 2021, TRAIDE continued working with a number of private and public organizations (reported on in 2020) and started 2 new supportive partnerships.
Strengthened economic institutions in order to improve the investment climate

title.narrative: Number of supported Dutch interventions in the local business climate for PSD

description.narrative: The number of supported Dutch interventions in 2021 increased to 3. Assignments within TRAIDE that supported ongoing Dutch interventions relate to digitalization, the water sector and conducting new activities to better support and promote Dutch interventions and existing financial instruments (in particularly RVO).

description.narrative: Support and improved planning for investment, trade, or service provision

title.narrative: Number of companies with a supported plan to invest, trade or provide services.

description.narrative: In 2021, there were 7 companies with a supported plan to invest in Rwanda. Firstly, TRAIDE Rwanda supported a consortium of 5 partners with an RVO Impact Cluster application, which got approved in December 2021 and has a total investment size of >950.000 EUR. Secondly, TRAIDE provided extensive local market knowledge and contacts to various companies to support them in their decision to set up a business in Rwanda. Only the companies that actually started to work or invest in Rwanda are included in this number. The number of total company support is higher.
